glass swords this album is basically
like dying and then going the video game
heaven the album starts off with these
two listening ethereal synthesizers and
this really infinite guitar solo and
everything is atmospheric and and
everything is reverb Dan just huge and
an arena sized and it just kind of feels
like the start screen to a Super

mood on the second track it goes full
throttle into a series of songs that
just remind me of playing Capcom games
on NES and Super Nintendo and Sega
Genesis when I was a kid or maybe even
doing something like playing Street
Fighter 2 turbo on an arcade cab at the
local arcade and kicking everyone's butt
and getting the high score I didn't even
use in any quarters and I'm actually
getting Zangief to do a piledriver crazy
I mean rusty goes even further to make
the link between his music and video

Navi from Zelda's ocarina of time on the

look there is a really huge video game
theme on this album but you will catch a

there spots here where I'm hearing Juke
and dubstep and synth funk it kind of

jukey repetitive chopped and looped

scattered beats twittering away in the

loud build ups before they drop into a

comes in kind of like a dubstep tune but
the wobbling bass isn't there a funk

and there are also moments on here on
catching a really strong hip-hop flavor
like the song City Star where man just
just the drum programming really reminds
me of something Lex Luger would do maybe
I could see somebody like Rick Ross or
even waka flocka flame rapping over it
maybe what kind of keeps that from
happening in my head is that the
synthesizers are just way too bright and
neon colored and sugary kind of
bombastic and I would sum this album up
in that word a little bit no matter what
kind of style or idea a song on this
album is chasing it's always kind of
coming out loud and flashy
it's like Sonic hedonism but that kind
of has a negative side to it for me
because it makes this album a little
one-dimensional I think you've got all
these tracks trying to be as pleasurable
as they can as fast as they can and as a
result a lot of them use the same exact
tricks to go about creating that
atmosphere really similar beats really
similar layering really similar build
ups like the beat em up games like final

soundtrack there's not much of a

much variation really all attack from
the same angle I think what you get out
of this LP has a lot to do with what you
go into it looking for this is not your
chin scratching electronica album that's
really soft and subtle this is louder
and brighter but definitely not as
trashy or is dumbed down
as something you would you would
